div1.p: Prière de transmettre au Cabinet de Monsieur le Ministre une note concernant l'Affaire ci-jointe renseignements que nous pourrions ainsi 20 s'il y aurait moyen de sommer satis facteur en faisant Juger plus tôt. voici no 588 du présent courrier M Vervyn

Mr. Stabler will call at the Bureau of Prince Albert de Ligne, Cabinet du Ministre des Colonies, and express verbally to him, with the request that it be brought to the attention of his Chief, the interest felt by the Government of the United States in the case of Mr. S.H. Ball, an American citizen, who has been summonsed to appear before the court at Lusambo to answer the charge, brought against him by the Congo authorities, of having, on September 30, 1908, killed certain natives. The killing of these natives is not denied but from evidence in the possession of the Department of State it clearly appears that Mr. Ball and those associated with him, were acting in self defense against an attempted massacre by the natives and that but for the prompt action they would doubtless have all paid the penalty with their lives.

The American Consul-General in the Congo has brought all the facts in the case to the attention of the Department of State with the recommendation that it facilitate the arrangements and hasten the time for the trial of the case against Mr. Ball. I am instructed to unofficially bring the matter to the attention of the Congo authorities and to express the hope that Mr. Ball may, on account of his physical condition, be given an early trial at a convenient place. You are requested to bring the views of the Department informally to the attention of the Colonial Office through Prince Albert de Ligne and to ascertain whether the Colonial Office is in possession of information relative to the case.

Please send a note to Mister Minister's Cabinet concerning the Affaire attached hereintelligence that we could just as 20 if there were moyen de sommer satis facteur making Juger earlier. here number 588 of the present mail M Vervyn
